SEARCH
Package io.lyuda.jcards

Class Dice

java.lang.Object
io.lyuda.jcards.Dice
public class Dice extends Object
The Dice class represents a dice with an arbitrary amount of sides, defined in the constructor (six by default). This class contains methods to access the number of sides, as well as rolling the dice to generate a random number. The class uses a cryptographically secure random number generator to generate the random number. The class also keeps track of the last result of the roll() method.
Since:
0.0.6
Author:
KonnosBaz, lyudaio
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Dice

      public Dice()
      Default constructor that Constructs a new Dice with six sides. This constructor is called when no arguments are passed to the constructor. It is equivalent to Dice(6). ‘this’ keyword is used to call another constructor from the same class.
      See Also:
      • Dice(int)
      • getSides()
      • roll()

    • Dice

      public Dice(int sides)
      Constructs a new Dice with a specified number of sides. The number of sides must be positive. If it is not, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. A cryptographically secure random number generator is used for rolling the dice. It is initialized in the constructor. The lastRoll field is initialized to 0. It is assigned a value in the roll() method.
      Parameters:
      sides - the number of sides.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if sides are non-possitive.
      See Also:
      • getSides()
      • roll()
      • getLastRoll()
      • SecureRandom
      • IllegalArgumentException
      • IllegalStateException

  • Method Details

    • getSides

      public int getSides()
      Returns the number of sides on the dice.
      Returns:
      the number of sides on the dice.

    • roll

      public int roll()
      Returns a random number between 1 and the number of sides on the dice, using a cryptographically secure random number generator. The result of the roll is assigned to the lastRoll field before the method returns.
      Returns:
      random number between 1 and the number of sides on the dice.

    • getLastRoll

      public int getLastRoll()
      Returns the result of the last dice roll.
      Returns:
      the result of the last dice roll.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the dice has not been rolled yet.
